alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 11:00PM EDT until October 08 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Essex County in New York. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from current rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1058 PM EDT, Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Local law enforcement have reported several flooded roads in Ticonderoga and Westport. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriah, Elizabethtown, Port Henry, Crown Point Center, Jay In Essex County, Schroon Lake, Lewis, North Hudson, New Russia, Witherbee, Mineville, Underwood, Moriah Center, Mullen Bay, Wadhams, Ironville, Reber, Paradox, Deerhead and Grass Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
